About

Professional life

I am certified as a web designer since 2002.

At my latest job at ESN (European Services Network), a leading provider of multilingual, multi-channel, multimedia communication services to the European institutions. I worked there since 2008 as a web integrator and a front-end web developer where I got to work on many exciting projects for the European Commission and the Flemish Government.

I dabble in user interface design, user experience, wire-framing and prototyping. I create mobile-friendly and responsive websites. I have a knack for accessibility, semantic mark-up.

Experience with feature-driven development, Agile, SCRUM and JIRA. Avid user of front-end tools like SASS, Grunt,â€¦ to speed-up, improve and organise workflow of a project. Embrace KISS and DRY principles.

Follow all latest UI design trends, accessibility and emerging technologies. Find me actively discussing any of these topics on Twitter.

Skills

Web Stack

  • Linux (Ubuntu), Terminal
  • Sublime editor

Front-end tools

  • HTML 5 & CSS 3: Selectors, Media Queries, OOCSS, BEM, AM Modules for CSS
  • XHTML 1, XML 1
  • CSS pre-processors (SASS)
  • SVG
  • Bootstrap framework
  • Jquery, Mootools, plain javascript
  • Grunt (node.js), Angular JS (Routes)

Web Standards and Accessibility

  • W3C standards
  • WAI-ARIA
  • WCAG 2.0, Section 508 accessibility guidelines

Visual Design Tools

  • Photoshop, Fireworks, Gimp
  • Illustrator, Inkscape
  • Wire-framing and proto-typing: Mindmeister, Axure
  • Design in the browser

Content Management Systems

  • Drupal: +5 years of experience, participate in the Drupal community, Drush, build custom themes (front-end and admin themes) with emphasis on Front-end performance , Drupal Coding Standards, Panels, Context, Views, phpTemplate (PHP & Drupal API), Composer
  • In-house ColdFusion CMS: building theme with Coldfusion and XML, static HTML site generator.
  • Jekyll: liquid template and Ruby on Rails, static HTML site generator.

Software Development

  • Agile: Scrum. Feature-driven development in a team of front-end developers, back-end developers and UX designers together with the Product Owner and Scrum Master . Daily stand-up meetings.
  • Project-based (waterfall)
  • Peer review, Quality control and - Assesment.

Unit testing

  • Selenium and Browser Stack (screenshot diffs UI)

Languages

  • English (Full professional proficiency)
